non_compliant.section: You agree not to access the Website by any means other than through the interface that is provided by Faraday for use in accessing the Website, and will not be copied or posted on any network computer or broadcast in any media. You also agree that Faraday copyright notice must appear in all copies made, and the Content of the Website unchanged.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing, Conditions for consent
non_compliant.amend:
This section restricts users' rights to access and use the website content, which may contradict the GDPR's principles of data access and portability. Users have the right to access and use their data in ways they see fit, as long as it doesn't infringe on copyright law.  

To amend this, rephrase the section to clarify that users can access and download their data, but Faraday retains copyright over the website and its underlying software. For example:

"You agree to access the Website only through the interface provided by Faraday. You may not copy, reproduce, distribute, or publicly display the Website or its content, except for downloading and making reasonable copies of your own data, subject to applicable copyright laws. All copies must retain Faraday's copyright notice and any other proprietary notices."

non_compliant.section: YOU EXPRESSLY UNDERSTAND AND "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" BASIS.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Storage limitations, Data protection by design and by default
non_compliant.amend:
Disclaiming liability with "as is" and "as available" clauses doesn't absolve Faraday from its GDPR obligations, particularly regarding data security (Article 5(1)(e)) and data protection by design and default (Article 25). 

To amend this, Faraday should implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including safeguards against accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure of, or access to personal data. The "as is" and "as available" disclaimer should not contradict these obligations.
